sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for the 1st person singular communis bound pronoun after a vowel.

revisionDesc.change: updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

wib:featureValueObservation.note: when followed by the negative morpheme -š it becomes -yī-
in some cases the authors recorded -yí
the 1.c.s. possessive pron. suff. attached to prepositions of which the base is one consonant or which ends in a vowel is -ay(ya) and not lengthened to -ayyī́ .
-yi is attested only in the village dialects alongside -y.
